description:
This is -- rather was -- such a great music-editing environment I can hardly imagine going back to the old way -- edit your Lilypond file with a text editor, run it through Lilypond, go back to the text editor and fix your mistakes, lather, rinse, repeat ... BUT the version in the repository, 3.1.3, doesn't work with the latest version of Python. 
There is a new version, 3.2, but if you want to run it you have to install it yourself and there's a heap of arcane dependencies. Some of us can work through them. I may do it yet.
summary: Can we get the new version into the repository?

description:
Same problem here as Jim.

Now rendered useless.

Frescobaldi helps with syntax, has help documents built in, and many thing I haven't had a chance to explore. There's a large community for Lilypond music notation (text based notation setting). Frescobaldi has been my go to for at least 10 years! (-_-)
summary: Great Music Notation Software for Lilypond Text Editing

description:
Used to be a great program and work fine. Since upgrade to python 3.10 it no longer runs keep getting the message :
Traceback (most recent call last):
 File "/usr/share/frescobaldi/frescobaldi_app/widgets/linenumberarea.py", line 83, in paintEvent
  rect.moveTop(geom.top())
TypeError: moveTop(self, int): argument 1 has unexpected type 'float'

Please fix!

Beaucoup de petites fonctionnalités sympathiques dans tous les coins dont je ne pourrais plus me passer : pouvoir utiliser facilement plusieurs versions de LilyPond, que la version soit sélectionnée automatiquement à partir du \version, exécuter facilement convert-ly et voir les modifications avant d'appliquer, l'autocomplétion, la réindentation, le changement de langue pour les noms des notes, la conversion du relatif en absolu, …
